definition: (classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)
(classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)

sentences.english: The child puckered up her lips and began to smile innocently.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子抿了抿嘴脣，傻乎乎地笑了。

sentences.english: I expected that the Queen does not enjoy being gawked at.
sentences.chinese: 我想女王不會喜歡被人傻乎乎地盯住不放。
有害的“脂肪”能使你傻乎乎麼？

sentences.english: Then, I also "silly" to pray for a small handkerchief.
sentences.chinese: 接着，我還“傻乎乎”地爲小手帕祈禱。

sentences.english: Besides, it aint the giggle it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，它不再是過去傻乎乎大笑的它。

sentences.english: What are you wearing that stupid while suit for?
sentences.chinese: 你穿那身傻乎乎的白西裝做什麼？

sentences.english: Jesse looks so dorky with his new haircut and glasses.
sentences.chinese: 傑西剛剪頭髮戴上新眼鏡的樣子看起來傻乎乎的。

sentences.english: The model looked at her reflection in the mirror with an idiotic simper.
sentences.chinese: 模特兒帶着傻乎乎的微笑望着鏡子裏自己的相貌。

definition: to be foolish/to play dumb/to gaze absentmindedly
to giggle/to laugh foolishly/to smirk/to simper
